[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 77]
Reasoning: **The Shop Phase: A Calculated Pass**

Okay, so I'm in the Shop after snagging a Pluto card – nice! Ante 3, Round 8. Money's at $19. I'm thinking about maximizing that sweet, sweet interest. Currently at $3, but if I can push to $20, it jumps to $4 – that's a decent return, especially this late in the run.

My Joker setup is pretty solid: DNA, Brainstorm (copying DNA), Blue Joker (massive chips!), Mail-In Rebate, and Ride the Bus. Ride the Bus is particularly key for this High Card deck. It's built for consistency.

The shop offers "The High Priestess" for $2. It creates two random Planet cards. The Telescope Voucher I have and the focused build I am going for makes it tempting but, is a bit of a gamble, even if it is a cheap gamble. I can only hold one card. I also have a Death consumable, so I would only be able to acquire one of the planets from the High Priestess. The main issue is that random planets could be useless. But it's $2 - so low risk. Still, I have to weigh losing a Death slot to a random Planet, and the potential value.

I am not building a pure planet deck.

Rerolling is an option, but at $5, it's a bit pricey right now, considering interest. I'm probably better off saving the money.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.

reasoning:
**Strategic Hand Selection for Victory**

Okay, here's the breakdown. We're at Ante 3/8, Round 9, in the "SELECTING_HAND" phase, specifically during the Boss Blind: The Wheel. My goal is to hit 4000 chips; I'm currently at 3528, meaning I need 472 more. I have two hands remaining, four discards. High Card is the chosen hand type; it's currently at Level 4, which gives a base of 35 chips and a base multiplier of 4.

I've got a solid Joker setup.  "Blue Joker" adds +102 chips to the pot, based on the cards in my deck. "Mail-In Rebate," a holographic Joker, grants +10 mult and gives me $5 for discarded 6's (rank changes every round). And "Ride the Bus," also holographic, gives a +10 mult because the previous hand was a non-face card. DNA and Brainstorm Jokers were already utilized this round.

Looking at my hand: I've got a King of Spades, a 5 of Spades, a 10 of Hearts, a 2 of Hearts, a King of Clubs, and three 10 of Diamonds. My previous hand, position 7, was a 10 of Diamonds as well.

My target is 472 chips. The Joker multiplier is calculated as: 4 (Base) + 10 (Mail-In Rebate) + 10 (Ride the Bus) = 24. My total Joker chips are 102 (from Blue Joker).  If I play a single 10 of Diamonds, my total chips will be: 35 (Base) + 10 (Card) + 102 (Blue Joker) = 147. My estimated score will be 147 * 24 = 3528. This should easily exceed the required 472.

Playing a single card also keeps "Ride the Bus" adding more mult. Right now it adds +10, but the description clearly says +1 for consecutive hands played without a face card.

Since I am playing a single card, it triggers before the scoring. So, my calculations are:

Mult: 4 + 10 + 11 = 25.
Chips: 35 + 10 + 102 = 147.
Score: 147 * 25 = 3675.

This is a surefire win, and 3675 is > 472.

I will play a single 10 of Diamonds in position 7.
